The problem is to find the minimal number of operations needed to create a copy of the dishes. 

The input consists of multiple test cases. The first line contains a single integer \( n \) \( 1 \le n \le 3 \cdot 10^5 \) — the number of dishes. The next line contains a single integer \( m \) \( 1 \le m \le 3 \cdot 10^5 \) — the number of shops. The next \( m \) lines contain two integers \( x_j \) and \( y_j \) \( 1 \le x_j, y_j \le n \) — the number of servings the red and black peppers packages in such a way that each dish will get the pepper added once, and no pepper is left. 

The output should print \( m \) integers. For each shop, print the maximum total tastiness of the dishes after Monocarp buys pepper packages only in this shop and adds the the said way.
